required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Out-of-Pocket Costs, Lost Wages, and Unemployment in Patients With Breast Cancer Undergoing Breast Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Financial Toxicity in Patients Undergoing Breast Reconstruction: The Impact of Out of Pocket Costs, Lost Wages and Unemployment

brief_summary.textblock: This trial studies the impact of out-of-pocket costs, lost wages, and unemployment in patients with breast cancer undergoing breast surgery. Post-mastectomy reconstructive patients are at high risk for financial toxicity (adverse effects of escalating health care cost on well-being). This study is being done to collect information about financial costs patients may have as a result of breast reconstruction. This may help researchers demonstrate the financial consequences of undergoing breast surgery.

detailed_description.textblock:
PRIMARY OBJECTIVES:
I. Obtain Comprehensive Score for financial Toxicity (COST) questionnaire data from the patients who are undergoing any form of breast reconstruction.
II. To determine which patients are at higher risk of financial toxicity while pursuing breast reconstruction.
III. Assess if financial toxicity or distress is associated with worse BREAST-questionnaire (Q) performance as well as quality of life.
IV. To estimate total out of pocket expenses and lost production due to treatment.
OUTLINE:
Patients complete up to 4 electronic questionnaires over 15 minutes before surgery and at 6, 12, and 24 months after surgery . Patients also complete a web-based cost diary to capture out-of-pocket expenses monthly for 12 months.
After completion of study, patients will be followed up for 1 year.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 1 year after completion of study
primary_outcome.description: Will be measured by the Comprehensive Score for financial Toxicity questionnaire and cost diary. Summary statistics including mean, standard deviation, median, and range for continuous variables, and frequency count and percentage for categorical variables will be provided. Various subgroup analyses may occur. In these cases, continuous variables will be compared using the two-sample t-test and categorical variables will be compared using chi-squared test or Fisher's exact test. Multivariate regression analysis will be performed to account for confounding and to increase the robustness of any causal inference.

primary_outcome.measure: Relationship between financial toxicity and patient reported quality of life questionnaire
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 1 year after completion of study
primary_outcome.description: Will be assessed using the Short Form-12 survey. Summary statistics including mean, standard deviation, median, and range for continuous variables, and frequency count and percentage for categorical variables will be provided. Various subgroup analyses may occur. In these cases, continuous variables will be compared using the two-sample t-test and categorical variables will be compared using chi-squared test or Fisher's exact test. Multivariate regression analysis will be performed to account for confounding and to increase the robustness of any causal inference.

primary_outcome.measure: Relationship between financial toxicity and patient reported satisfaction with breast reconstruction questionnaire
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 1 year after completion of study
primary_outcome.description: Will be assessed using the Breast-Q survey. Summary statistics including mean, standard deviation, median, and range for continuous variables, and frequency count and percentage for categorical variables will be provided. Various subgroup analyses may occur. In these cases, continuous variables will be compared using the two-sample t-test and categorical variables will be compared using chi-squared test or Fisher's exact test. Multivariate regression analysis will be performed to account for confounding and to increase the robustness of any causal inference.

arm_group.description: Patients complete up to 4 electronic questionnaires over 15 minutes before surgery and at 6, 12, and 24 months after surgery . Patients also complete a web-based cost diary to capture out-of-pocket expenses monthly for 12 months.

study_pop.textblock: Patients who are evaluated for breast reconstruction at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Texas Medical Center, Katy, League City, Memorial City, Sugar Land, The Woodlands) and, pending Institutional Review Board approval, domestic institutions in the MD Anderson Cancer Network

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have an indication for surgical treatment of breast cancer
- English-speaking
- Able to complete consent
- Able to fill out computer survey material
Exclusion Criteria:
- Non-English-speaking
- Those with recurrent or metastatic disease
